description: Number of iterations required for the sum of n and its prime divisors = t to reach a prime (where t replaces n in each iteration) in A016837.
links: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
formula: Factor n, add n and its prime divisors. Sum = t, t replaces n, repeat until a prime is produced in k iterations.For x in A050703, a(x) = 1. - _Michel Marcus_, Jul 24 2015Number of iterations x->A075254(x) to reach a prime, starting at x=n. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 27 2015
maple: f:= proc(n) option remember; local t;   t:= n + convert(map(convert,ifactors(n)[2],`*`),`+`);   if isprime(t) then 1 else 1+procname(t) fiend proc:map(f, [$2..100]); # _Robert Israel_, Jul 26 2015
prog: (PARI) sfpn(n) = {my(f = factor(n)); n + sum(k=1, #f~, f[k,1]*f[k,2]);}a(n) = {nb = 1; while (! isprime(t=sfpn(n)), n=t; nb++); nb;}
author: _Enoch Haga_, _Carlos Rivera_, _Patrick De Geest_
